title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 28.6 - Hunters' permits
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 28.6 - Hunters' permits

State Regulations

Article V of IRP requires member jurisdictions to provide a
restricted plate or permit to move an empty vehicle from one lessee carrier
fleet to another by an owner/operator not operating as a lessor. Such an
owner/operator may apply for an in-transit permit from any district office of
the Department of Motor Vehicles as provided in section
401-a
of the Vehicle and Traffic Law. The district office shall contact the

International Registration Bureau of the department which shall issue an IRP-50
30 Day Unladen Weight Permit and transmit a copy of such permit to the
applicant through the facilities of the district office. Such modified 30 Day

Unladen Weight Permit/hunter's permit may be used only in accordance with the
terms contained thereon. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15
ยง
28.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
